PostToolUse.description: Oracle governance monitoring after code changes

hooks.prompt:
After modifying code, the forge-oracle agent monitors for governance compliance. If the changes appear to violate scope, architectural constraints, or governance rules, the oracle will write a warning to the sentinel log that appears in the Governance HUD.

Quick governance check:
1. Does this change align with the current directive in .claude/governance.json?
2. Are we touching files outside the stated scope?
3. Does this introduce architectural drift?

If any concerns are detected, use the Write tool to append a sentinel log entry to .claude/governance.json following this format:

```json
{
  "id": "oracle-<timestamp>-<random>",
  "timestamp": <current_time_ms>,
  "type": "WARN" | "INFO" | "CRITICAL",
  "severity": "low" | "medium" | "high",
  "category": "scope" | "drift" | "governance",
  "source": "forge-oracle",
  "message": "Clear, actionable message",
  "context": {
    "files": ["modified/file/path"],
    "workstream": "gov-001",
    "suggestion": "Recommended action"
  },
  "actionRequired": false
}
```

Only report high-confidence findings. When in doubt, skip. This is non-blocking guidance.
